figgy.title: Numismatics: Generate Report for any and all issues containing general "DOC" selection in citation field.

comments.body:
Implementation idea:

* Index numismatic reference
* Add an invisible facet for numismatic reference
* make the rendered version of a citation have a clickable reference -- link goes to search results page of all resources that have that same numismatic reference citation value.
* reindex issues

Reading this ticket, it doesn't seem like we need a report necessarily -- just a way to get to these resources that need to be updated, so a set of search results might be more efficient for the task.

figgy.title: Generate Report for "Patron Requests - Portions" and "Patron Requests" for stakeholder

comments.body: This is immediate need; more permanent solution will also be necessary; see #5677

We now know the resource count is 2043:

```sql
select COUNT(id) from orm_resources WHERE created_at between '2021-07-01' and '2022-06-30' AND metadata @> '{"member_ids": []}' AND (metadata @> '{"member_of_collection_ids": [{"id": "b7e8c42b-6fd0-4cfb-bc6d-b5e5a5c79f5c"}]}' OR metadata @> '{"member_of_collection_ids": [{"id": "a5454850-8b97-4750-8390-2c5884134f1f"}]}') AND NOT metadata @> '{"member_of_collection_ids": [{"id": "d7e0141b-ff30-4a9b-b260-09525662a65c"}]}'

```

The image count should be 319,450:

```sql
WITH RECURSIVE deep_members AS (
  select member.*
  FROM orm_resources a,
  jsonb_array_elements(a.metadata->'member_ids') AS b(member)
  JOIN orm_resources member ON (b.member->>'id')::UUID = member.id
  WHERE a.created_at between '2021-07-01' and '2022-06-30' AND a.metadata @> '{"member_ids": []}' AND (a.metadata @> '{"member_of_collection_ids": [{"id": "b7e8c42b-6fd0-4cfb-bc6d-b5e5a5c79f5c"}]}' OR a.metadata @> '{"member_of_collection_ids": [{"id": "a5454850-8b97-4750-8390-2c5884134f1f"}]}') AND NOT a.metadata @> '{"member_of_collection_ids": [{"id": "d7e0141b-ff30-4a9b-b260-09525662a65c"}]}'
  UNION
  SELECT mem.*
  FROM deep_members f,
  jsonb_array_elements(f.metadata->'member_ids') AS g(member)
  JOIN orm_resources mem ON (g.member->>'id')::UUID = mem.id
  WHERE f.metadata @> '{"member_ids": [{}]}'
)
select COUNT(*) AS count from deep_members
WHERE internal_resource = 'FileSet'

```

figgy.title: Generate report for any and all Graphic Arts items in Figgy

comments.body: I got a request for an update on this report. do we have an ETA?
@hackartisan I can do a search in figgy to confirm that all items / most items are in the GA collection in figgy

Requested Collections/Searches to run: 

- https://figgy.princeton.edu/?f%5Bmember_of_collection_titles_ssim%5D%5B%5D=Treasures+of+the+Graphic+Arts+Collection
- GA: https://figgy.princeton.edu/catalog?q=%22GA%22
- GAX/Patron Requests: https://figgy.princeton.edu/?f%5Bmember_of_collection_titles_ssim%5D%5B%5D=Patron+Requests&q=%22GAX%22

### User story 
_As a Graphic Arts Curator that is new to PUL, I would like a report generated of any/all GA/GAX items in the digital repository. I am in the process of preparing for a large 3-6 year cataloging and digitization project for my materials and I would like to get a better idea:_
1. How many items have been ingested in figgy from my collections
2. How many images (total) have been ingested in figgy from my collections
3. A CSV download of GA/GAX/"Treasures of the Graphic Arts Collection" items, containing:  The title, Source Metadata Identifier, Ark, Visibility, state, and call number
_I will use this information to determine what collections should be targeted for digitization, metadata cleanup, or metadata creation._
Note that GA and GAX are partial location code values.

Most are in the treasures of the GA collection, but I found items that are graphic arts materials in patron requests that were not tagged. I could probably just do that and it would be easier to run the report on your end, then.
@kelea99 It sounds like for a generalizable solution we'll need to be able to handle this location code value specification.

user story confirmed with Molly! She is also reviewing the two searches (listed above) outside of the Treasures of the graphic arts figgy collection. If all the items in those searches need to be added, I will do so and change the ticket to just generate a report for that one collection. Thank you, @hackartisan !

princeton_ansible.title: Add molecule verify hack to readme

comments.body: Turns out a playbook has to be on the main branch before you can create a Template in Tower based on it. So I'm going to merge this tonight so we have a template to start next steps on tomorrow.

The oawaiver role is now failing CI on the main branch, but the failure is an idempotence failure. Not sure if it's related. The test run is here:
https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/actions/runs/4198847185/jobs/7283000031 
and the 'changed' tasks include:
```
  TASK [ruby_s : ruby_s | uninstall wrong version of bundler] ********************
  changed: [instance]
  
  TASK [ruby_s : ruby_s | get gem home] ******************************************
  changed: [instance]
  
  TASK [ruby_s : ruby_s | remove installed bundler if default] *******************
  changed: [instance]
  
  TASK [ruby_s : ruby_s | install global bundler, specific version] **************
  changed: [instance]
  
  TASK [ruby_s : ruby_s | install global bundler, any version] *******************
  skipping: [instance]
  
  TASK [ruby_s : ruby_s | update rubygems] ***************************************
  changed: [instance]
  
  TASK [ruby : ruby | install the dependencies] **********************************
  skipping: [instance]
```

tiger-data-app.title: Create a basic layout using bootstrap

comments.body:
> Was the secrets file introduced by accident? If it is intentional, and it's only production that is really secret, I'd suggest changing this warning:
> 
> > Make sure the secrets in this file are kept private if you're sharing your code publicly.

The file was introduced on purpose.  The production and staging are environment variables.  This matches with other repositories.

I thought I'd share a couple of thoughts and questions about how this would work:

1. To what extent would Rails controllers fulfill the role of the API (i.e., the views would constitute the UI)? Would scrupulously creating controller endpoints for any data that controllers or views/helpers fill the gaps?
2. I've seen token-based auth folded into controllers so browsers and automated clients use the same endpoints, but I think it's more common to have different endpoints.
3. One of the ramifications of having a significant external command-line/API customer base that Matt, Kate, and I discussed recently is that any backwards-incompatible changes would potentially break their integrations. Maybe this argues against considering Rails controllers the API?
4. What are the best practices for having a separate, versioned API?
5. I'm not sure that having a "Middle Layer" between the UI/API and the backend is a requirement, or if it's one possible approach to making sure that users don't have unmediated access to MediaFlux just because they are using a command-line tool or API integration. Basically, maybe this app is the "Middle Layer"?
